column4: i got ubuntu 10.04 and i installed ubuntu-tweak....i want my desktop settings back to its original state from the time i installed my distro....is it possible? using ubuntu tweak? and i havent do back ups?
what all did you change on the system?
if you mean reset gnome   you can do that without ubuntu tweak
if you mean compiz  then that can be done from ccsm
if you want gnome reset  use this command     sudo rm -rf .gnome .gnome2 .gconf .gconfd .metacity      hen restart X
doing that...is it safe for my files? i mean i got conky runnin too...and i got doc files... is it safe?
should be safe for conky...that command is to reset "gnome"  not application options
did you restart x
you have to restart x  or reboot in order to see the changes
nothings change.... :(
mm  thats not right...let me give you the command again and simply hightlight it here  then   middle click inside the terminal window to paste it
sudo rm -rf .gnome .gnome2 .gconf .gconfd .metacity
then restart x  by  hitting   ctrl+alt+F2   ...log in  then   sudo restart gdm
i got it! many thanx to you bro! i love u!
no problem
didnt see the pm ...what is the complete error on that file when you try to delete it
it says there was an error deleting unsaved document2. "error removing file: permission denied."
ok open a terminal   cd to the Desktop if that is where the file is   then  sudo chown -R  yourname  nameoffile
then you should be able to delete it
nothing happnd....i just typed wat u've instructed...and looking back on my desktop it's still there
you say that didnt work?
